Operation 'ExportSingleSendStat' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, missing_output_details, missing_side_effects. The original summary 'Export Single Send Stats' is generic and doesn't convey the CSV format or action specificity. The description, while informative, lacks clarity about what statistics are included in the export (bounces, clicks, opens, etc.) and doesn't clearly state the output format characteristics. Enhanced summary to be more action-oriented and specific about the format. Improved description to: (1) clarify the multiple ID input mechanism, (2) specify the types of metrics included (consistent with API purpose), (3) better explain the CSV output format and its usability, and (4) make it clearer for AI agents to understand when to use this operation versus other stats endpoints.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to export Single Send stats as .CSV data**.

You can specify one Single Send or many: include as many Single Send IDs as you need, separating them with commas, as the value of the `ids` query string parameter.

The data is returned as plain text response but in .CSV format, so your application making the call can present the information in whatever way is most appropriate, or just save the data as a .csv file.
data.summary_suggestion: Export Single Send campaign statistics in CSV format
data.description_suggestion: Exports statistics for one or more Single Send campaigns in CSV format. Accepts multiple Single Send IDs as comma-separated values in the `ids` query parameter. Returns campaign statistics including metrics such as bounces, clicks, opens, and other engagement data as plain text in CSV format. The response can be directly saved as a .csv file or parsed by your application for further processing.
data.reasoning: The original summary 'Export Single Send Stats' is generic and doesn't convey the CSV format or action specificity. The description, while informative, lacks clarity about what statistics are included in the export (bounces, clicks, opens, etc.) and doesn't clearly state the output format characteristics. Enhanced summary to be more action-oriented and specific about the format. Improved description to: (1) clarify the multiple ID input mechanism, (2) specify the types of metrics included (consistent with API purpose), (3) better explain the CSV output format and its usability, and (4) make it clearer for AI agents to understand when to use this operation versus other stats endpoints.

message: Operation 'ExportAutomationStat' has semantic quality issues: vague_summary, inconsistent_terminology, missing_output_details. The summary incorrectly references 'Single Send Stats' when the endpoint path indicates it's for Automations (/v3/marketing/stats/automations/export). This is a critical inconsistency. The description also has the same terminology mismatch. Added clarity about the CSV format output and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability regarding when to use this export operation versus retrieving stats directly.

data.current_description:
**This endpoint allows you to export Single Send stats as .CSV data**.

You can specify one Single Send or many: include as many Single Send IDs as you need, separating them with commas, as the value of the `ids` query string parameter.

The data is returned as plain text response but in .CSV format, so your application making the call can present the information in whatever way is most appropriate, or just save the data as a .csv file.
data.description_suggestion:
**This endpoint allows you to export Automation stats in CSV format.**

You can export stats for one or multiple Automations by providing comma-separated Automation IDs in the `ids` query string parameter. The response returns CSV-formatted data as plain text that can be saved directly as a .csv file or processed by your application. This is useful for analyzing Automation performance data in external tools or for record-keeping purposes.
data.reasoning: The summary incorrectly references 'Single Send Stats' when the endpoint path indicates it's for Automations (/v3/marketing/stats/automations/export). This is a critical inconsistency. The description also has the same terminology mismatch. Added clarity about the CSV format output and use cases to improve AI agent interpretability regarding when to use this export operation versus retrieving stats directly.
